Ω_b identity (derived under explicit TFPT topological assumptions)

beta_rad = varphi0/(4π) = 0.0042312895113954151087468182088050163950728077266837257698944229030526732721556263
conjectured coeff (4π-1) = 11.566370614359172953850573533118011536788677597500423283899778369231265625144836
Ω_b_pred = (4π-1)*beta_rad = 0.048940662665450112200545653760944651480054952073107413870556556782266783965399009

Conditional derivation assumptions (explicit):
- two_physical_cycles: The relevant sector-counting measure reduces to exactly two physical boundary cycles contributing 2π each.  ⇒  4π  [assumed (topological sector-counting lemma)]
- subtract_trivial_sector: Subtract the trivial/identity-sector weight by 1 in the same normalization.  ⇒  4π - 1  [assumed (normalization convention for sector weights)]

Reference (Planck 2018 base-ΛCDM; derived Ω_b):
- reference file: /Users/stefanhamann/Projekte/wolfram_latex_attachments/tfpt-suite/tfpt_suite/data/global_reference_minimal.json
- Ω_b h^2 = 0.02237 ± 0.00015
- H0 = 67.36 ± 0.54 km/s/Mpc  =>  h=0.6736 ± 0.0054
- Ω_b_ref = Ω_b h^2 / h^2 = 0.049301692328524438476424754994611856173233055557122787616860658651215012327847394 ± 0.00085681142747140931509835404112378635706093499964689237552400217734754363189007356
- implied K = Ω_b_ref / beta_rad = 11.651694405629429043797258843658647965296882219275850104857513513312484643132285
- sigma(K) ≈ 0.20249416287018514618165626709303844372959979728553279196733122047743218865530301
- error of (4π-1): |(4π-1) - K| = 0.085323791270256089946685310540636428508204621775426820957735144081219017987448935

Checks:
- omega_b_identity_derived_from_tfpt_qft: PASS (derived under explicit topological sector-counting assumptions: coeff = (2 cycles * 2π) - 1 = 4π - 1)
- conditional_assumptions_explicit: PASS (assumptions listed: ['two_physical_cycles', 'subtract_trivial_sector'])
- omega_b_pred_value: PASS (Ω_b_pred = (4π-1)β_rad = 0.048940662665450112200545653760944651480054952073107413870556556782266783965399009)
- conjectured_coeff_within_1sigma: PASS (|K-(4π-1)| = 0.085323791270256089946685310540636428508204621775426820957735144081219017987448935 <= sigma(K)≈0.20249416287018514618165626709303844372959979728553279196733122047743218865530301)
- omega_b_pred_close_to_ref: PASS (Ω_b_ref(Planck-derived)=0.049301692328524438476424754994611856173233055557122787616860658651215012327847394 ± 0.00085681142747140931509835404112378635706093499964689237552400217734754363189007356; z=0.42136420161876677000367973320797446587566756753859587513815273381624114611581163)

Notes:
- The derivation here is conditional: it encodes a minimal sector-counting argument (2 physical 2π cycles and a trivial-sector subtraction).
- Planck-derived Ω_b is used only to quantify agreement; it does not by itself prove the sector-counting assumptions.
- If you want an operator/anomaly-level derivation, replace the assumptions block with an explicit anomaly/inflow computation and keep the same regression targets.
